J'ai très peu joué à ce jeu : le système de combat n'est pas terrible et il semblerait que tous les doubleurs français aient perdus leur âmes juste avant l'enregistrement.

I played this game with my friend on xbox and pc I like it :)  I also love the music it plays at the start :3  good game try it out It's not that much to buy and the game has a lot of stuff and I mean a lot there are some really cool stuff in this game plus the dlc is good.

A solid RPG with many features. Very playable. Even re-playable. 

Especially like:
- Seamless nature of the world. Very few load-screens. Even entering towns and homes is seamless. This is how it should be!
- Variety of quests and goals, mostly optional.
- Engaging skill choices.

Quibbles. Not really "dislike" but "somewhat annoying"
- Times when the merchants are wandering around randomly. Finding the same merchant again is a pain.
- Horses steer like they're brain-damaged. Sometimes will veeer off to one side and suddenly you can't steer anymore.
- Horses again. You can't ride down a hill, but you can get off the horse and call it down the hill. WTF?
- Some of the quests are incredibly obtuse, relying more on luck and happenstance than on deliberate planning.

Major bugs:
- The crashing. Especially after saving a few times, it'll just crash on my system. No response from either Steam or the "official" game support.
- The dialog. Only looking at some videos did I realize there was supposed to be dialog! Totally not working on my system. I only get the text, but everyone is silent.


Definitely worth the buy. Now if I could just convince Steam to let me have the Strategy Guide I paid for. It's DLC, but it refuses to install. I'm guessing it's a Steam issue, but they keep passing the buck to the publisher, who has no control over Steam.

PS: August 2018: Took a while, but I finally got that strategy guide!
It took a year for me to make that shit work and when I finally succed to open it, the game crashed when I tried to change the resolution...

Interesting world full of weird and wonderful creatures. So it is a shame the gameplay kind of mostly sucked.  I always wanted to give this one a go. They called it the next Oblivion on the box. It ran like crap on the 360 console. The PC disc version had some annoying DRM. Finally on Steam I got to play it all and with the addon's. My advice maybe skip this and just go to Two Worlds 2.
ok
С пивасом потянет.

Two Worlds es el un buen Rol o RPG al mas puro estilo de Oblivion, dándonos un gigantesco mundo y variedad enorme de modos de lucha, clases y poderes como enemigos, su historia que es bastante larga se extiende aun mas si tenemos que hacer la cantidad de misiones secundarias vayamos donde fuera, inclusive si vamos directo a los poblados o ciudades para hacer la trama principal nos toparemos con mas de una misión secundaria. Su apartado grafico es bastante sencillo pero bien detallado como ambientado, nos deja con buen gusto para ser del 2007, su temas de fondo o banda sonora nos acompañan siempre y a veces esos sonidos de espada y modo de lucha son algo chistosos pero divierten y dan ganas de seguir buscando enemigos, los cuales ahi que luchar si queremos subir nuestro personaje de niveles para acceder a mejores armaduras, armas etc. Luchar a caballo es una de las cosas mas hard del juego pero nos ahorra tiempo si no buscamos los teleport por el mundo. Sin mas vueltas es un juego que te deja con ganas de explorar y luchar si te gusto TESIV: Oblivion (2006) y si tenemos problemas para ejecutarlo id a foros steam y descargar el Physix legacy para poder correrlo sin problemas, es un buen buen juego en general, ya veremos su segunda parte.

Nota: 7/10
Polecam

This review was on the strategy guide only.

It originally said:

The game may be okay but DO NOT buy the strategy guide.  It will not download for many and they provide ZERO support.  I've owned it since 3/21/16 and have been trying to get help to actually install the guide for two weeks..

My new edit:

After months of trying to find help on the issue I've come to realize they screwed up on their process.  When I purchased the Epic Edition they added the Strategy Guide to my library but it would not download.

When I would try putting it in my cart it would say I already owned it so I went round and round with Steam, Topware, and the forum Dev for months. BUT, now I think I understand what happened through no help from any of the support areas...

They had the purchasing part screwed up and it was giving the Guide when it should not have.  The download portion however knew I didn't own it so wouldn't download it.  They finally fixed it so now when I add it to my cart it no longer shows that I already own it and it no longer shows on my owned DLC page.

So, they screwed up, took months to fix it, and didn't explain shit but I won't hold it against the guide/game any longer.

played the hell out of this on the Xbox 360 when it was $5, the PC port is just as good with overall somewhat better performance I guess; Still just as fun, still just as buggy.

I had the opportunity to play this game when it came out,  sadly  I had a hard time with it. It was difficult and I decided to stop playing it, however I always wished to finish it. 

Now I got it again for a ridiculous low  price, and even that the game has very weird and sometimes annoying controls (Yes I am talking to you, horse!!). I can say I am enjoying it now. I still have very little game time, but compared with the first time I played it,  now I really feel I am making progress! 

What I can say, is that if you have the patience to overlook the flaws of this game and withstand  the voice acting of the cleaning staff of Reality Pump :) , you will find a very entertaining experience in this role-playing game.

Two Worlds is a game I had originally heard of, but never played until about a year ago. I didn't keep up with the hype and the marketing for this game, and it was because of a YouTuber called ProJared and his review of this game that I bought it, mainly to see if it was as bad as he said it was. And - surprise, surprise - he was right.

Two Worlds, according to ProJared's Review (be prepared to see ProJared's name come up a LOT in this "review"), was going to put another game - The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion - to shame. Needless to say, it didn't even come close to matching Oblivion in anything. And I'm going to prove it.

The game starts off with the Main Character and his twin sister, Kira, riding through the rain. Kira is injured, and falls off the horse. Here is where one of the many problems of Two Worlds starts to show. First off, the voice acting. It's God-awful. Every single voice actor - well, with an exception or two - is bad. Every line of speech is forced, no emotion is in the dialogue and even worse, the text in the game looks like it was written by someone trying to emulate Shakespeare.

The story for this game is simple. As the Main Character goes to look for a shelter that he and Kira can stay in for the night to keep out of the rain, Kira gets kidnapped. About six months later, in the first village you're in (I don't remember what it was called, just more proof of how bad this game is) you recieve a letter telling you that your sister is alive. After reading the letter, the village elder gives you your first quest, the traditional cliché quest at the beginning of most RPGs out there: clear a cave of monsters. You do that, you come out of the cave which is really a temple, and when you're through with that task, some guy from the first village tells you that some "hard warriors" have come looking for you. After that, you find the man who kidnapped your sister - Gandohar - and he tells you to go and meet his master Reist in the Goat's Cave. You meet Reist, and he tells you to go and talk to Gandohar. Refresh my memory, why did I need to go in there again? Anyways, speaking with Gandohar reveals that he "claims" that he wants to help Kira, and to do that, he needs you to go and collect four treasures representing the four elements: Fire, Wind, Water, and Earth. There's also a fifth piece that binds them together just like that ring from Lord of the Rings. And apparently, only the Main Character and Kira can touch the key and nobody else can, similar to the Vampire Killer whip from the Castlevania franchise. That's really all I can say about the story, because I pretty much quit playing after that.

Gameplay: The gameplay is somewhat similar to Oblivion, but they somehow managed to screw that up. When you're fighting anything in this game, and I mean anything, it all basically amounts to a button masher swinging wildly at everything around you, and I mean everything. There's no surefire way to be sure that you're hitting something other than the blood that shoots out of enemies, and the punch sound that accompanies trying to hit something with a steel blade that clearly is there to cause bruises rather than draw blood, but whatever.

The graphics here are a mixed bag. The character models and everything look awful, to the point where they would barely pass as PS2 graphics, and they're animated so poorly. The lip-synching is also terrible, which makes Godzilla movies look masterful. However, and this is what I mean by the graphics being a mixed bag, is that not everything looks terrible, the enviroments are kind of nice. I can admit that.

The music sounds like your typical midieval sword & sorcery-style RPG, with light tunes when exploring, heavy tunes when in danger, things like that.

All in all, I have to say that it's a damn shame this game didn't quite live up to the hype, because it shows great potential that could have easily put The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion to shame, but they let their ambitions and a clichéd story along with awful gameplay get in the way of it all. Also, the voice acting was really disappointing as well. Still, hopefully they learned their lesson with this game and made Two Worlds II MUCH better, but I'll be going into it expecting the worst.

Хорошая РПГ. Я не пожалел, что заглянул в этот мир. Многообразие городов, множество рас и существ не оставят равнодушным любознательного путешествика. География мира очень широка. От ледников на севере до пустыни Драккар и Пустошей на юге. Основной сюжет хоть и коротковат, но очень интересен. Но чтобы полностью погрузиться в этот мир, нужно выполнять все задания. Обширный выбор брони и оружия. Несколько видов магии. В целом игра очень интересная. Не такая конечно, как Готика 3 или TES4:Oblivion, вышедшие ранее, но ценителю РПГ стоит поиграть. Я бы поставил 8 из 10.

If you do not like this game..,,you suck. What a hidden gem, I got it on sale and played it a bit like I do most of the games I buy and then go back to them later and play a bit more. But this game is quite addictive, and I really dont see anything wrong with the graphics. Nice enviroments, somewhat ugly animals but I can live with that. The human characters are a bit goofy but there are so many good things about this game that any not up to snuff eye candy is easily overlooked. Very large map and a good bit of content makes this a sleep killer.

If you like a good fatasy rpg then this is a good game. It's s cheap 10$ game. Most reveiews when doing pros and cons talk about the stale converstaions and clunkcy battle actions. I often remember this is Pre skyrim. So there is no mass amount of modders altering everything. 

Yes the characters in it aren't all eye candy or spouting 720 hd but the game is from 2009 so it should be given a little slack for it what it is. 

It's a good game and for the price should be worth it. If you have friends it can be even better because it doesn't say it but there are Online fetures and this game was one of the first that tried to hybread into a mmo. The mmo part is mostly dead but's still alive.

Two Worlds...wow what a game

Most of the things are bad but I still had fun with it. 


COMBAT

- Magic seemed kinda useless even at higher lvl spells. You can stack spells so they will get better but there is only one mage that sells spells( I heard there are 2 or 3 but I didn't found them). 

- Kinda stiff animations and unrealistic but I JUST LOVED when I  1-hit guys with the crit animation, that thing is timeless. It's also kinda hard at the beggining. Try to use two handed weapons since you can get all 4 hits with that, with one handed you can get just 2/4 hits(unless you put our enemy in a corner)

ATMOSPHERE & STORY

-Extremely bad voice acting, it's not even the kind you can make fun off. Some of the main storyline characters sound ok tho.

- Little to no atmosphere,  combat soundtracks play in the middle of the town??? and sometimes no music at all...people look braindead. NO ONE SEEMS THAT THEY WANT YOU TO HAVE FUN!

-Story is alright 

-I like that they tried to portray the character as a badass mercenary that cares only about money but the voice acting and face makes him look like a joke.


WORLD

-Massive,many dungeons but they are not worth exploring, a lot of them look cool and like one has a big throne room and a grave and things like that but there is nothing there to loot, NOTHING AT ALL THOSE THINGS ARE JUST DECOR ...WHY?



5/10 a game that its hard to get into, but its ok.

This is a "B-Movie" game to me.  It's "so bad, it's good."  The voice acting IS terrible, but I actually like it.  It's like a group of people trying to do their version of an old English accent.  And let's be honest, this game is basically trying to be Elder Scrolls, at least Oblivion.
The controls are a little tough to figure out at first, but back when I first played it and finally figured everything out, I had a tough time putting it down (XBox360).  Don't expect too much.  It's a fun open-world romp into the B-Version of Oblivion with delightfully terrible voice acting and fun combat.  Don't buy it at full price, and have fun!
An RPG classic, which dwarfs such titles as [b] Oblivion [/b] or [b] Warcraft [/b]. A "must-play" for a true gaming enthusiast. Truly the end of the line for all great RPG heroes

Si vous parlez francais, n'achetez pas ce jeu! J'ai récemment acheter le pack two words et les guides en DLC. Le jeu est bien, malgré un francais médiocre. La ou sa ce corse, c'est lors de l'instalation du guide pour two worlds epic edition. Le guide dit qu'il n'est pas installé, et impossible de l'installer. Donc je me retrouve a avoir acheter un guide dont je ne peux me servir. De plus, lorsque j'ai tenté de jointe le support du fabricant ( topware ), j'ai eu comme réponse qu'ils ne comprenait pas ma langue et que je devais le ecrire a nouveau en anglais ou en allemand. J'ai trouvé irrespectueux qu'une compagnie dise que le jeu est supporté en français, mais qu'elle soit incapable d'offrir un support dans les langue offertes dans le jeu. Pour ma part, je regrette amèrement mon achat meme si ce titre était en solde. N'achetez pas  ce jeu si vous esperez un support en francais.

Je me permet aussi un commentaire pour cette compagnie de *****, et je le ferait en Anglais pour etre sur d'etre compris si ceux ci, par hasard, lisent cette évaluation : Fix your shit guys, its nothing but crap!

Wenn man sich ein Open-World-Rollenspiel für 10 Euro kauft, erwartet man erstmal nicht so viel. So gings mir auch. Mein Gedanke beim Kauf war in etwa, dass man für den Preis nicht so viel falsch machen kann. 

Leider fällt es mir schwer, außer dem Preis irgendetwas positives zu finden. Ich versuchs trotzdem mal:
Am Anfang des Spiels gibt es eine durchaus vernünftige Questdichte und die Belohnungen sind auch noch irgendwie sinnvoll.. Ganz cool fand ich die Tatsache, dass man Waffen und Rüstungen stapeln und somit verstärken kann.
An dieser Stelle bin ich mit dem positiven Teil fertig.

Kommen wir zum Negativen. 
Dieses Spiel besitzt absolut keinen roten Faden. Man wird in eine "Story" reingeschmissen, die in einem Satz erklärt ist. 
Die Quest sind zum größten Teil wahl- und zusammenhangslos, was durch einfach völlig verwirrende Questkarte unterstützt wird. Dazu gibt es hier massenhaft Bugs. Dazu kommt, dass es ab einem gewissen Punkt quasi keine Quests mehr gibt. Man kann 100 Jahre über die Karte rennen, 3000 Wölfe und anderes Getier mit einem Schlag töten, 5000 Alchemiezutaten einsammeln und dabei nicht einen Quest finden. Einige Quest brechen random ab, weil die beteiligten Personen von Orks gekillt wurden, die die Stadt überrannt haben... Dazu fällt mir irgendwie nix ein.
Weiter gehts mit dem Skillsystem. Mit einem Wort: Einfallslos. Und, bemerkenswert: Es gibt nen aktiven "Skill" gegen berittene Gegner. Und ich hab nach 37h Spiel noch keinen berittenen Gegner gefunden. Na gut, vielleicht liegts auch an mir... 
Dann kann man sich noch bei verschiedenen Gilden beliebt machen. Auch hier suchen wir irgendein System vergebens. Ich könnte mich hier noch weiter auslassen, aber reicht denk ich. Hab vorher in den Empfehlungen ab und an gelesen, dass das Spiel etwas für RSP-Fans ist. Ich würde eher sagen, man muss ein leidenschafter RSP-Fan sein, um diesem Spiel überhaupt was abgewinnen zu können.

Also wenn ihr nen 10er übrig habt, wartet lieber, bis ihr noch einen findet und kauft euch dann ein richtiges Spiel.

Immer noch geiles spiel!!!!

My recommendation is ONLY for the DRM free version, which you get elsewhere but sadly not on steam!!!
Such a shame, the game was killed off by a greedy publisher with one of the worst (and first) DRM in gaming history. And with (limited) oline activations. Cancelled with every tiny change in the system. After 3 or 5 times you had to PHONE the support and beg for another activation.
The Steam version still has key and online activation. I dont know, to which extend the DRM crap is still in it..

Because underneath this it's actually a very nice open world RPG. Good story, Very big open world with lots of stuff to do and find. A good skill system. A interesting crafting system. And it doesn't even look too horrible today, given his age. Some animations are a bit strange and the voice acting isn't too great. Having said that: it looks better then morrwowind.
It was always in the shadow of the elder scroll and gothic games. And sure has it's rough edges but not too much. But concept wise it's not too far from the elder scrolls games.

PS: Invisible mouse pointer bug (only buttons higlighted, no keyboard control in menu)  with controller connected: blindly click your way to  interface options and turn hardware cursor off.
 It has controller support apprently but the option only appearred for me after registry fiddling (trying to turn hardware cursor off outside game, which i couldn't). You got to choose at game start, no flying swapping.
PPS: Via registry editing full 21:9 support in 3440x1440. Hello Skyrim.

Horse Collecting Simulator 2016.

The reason I love this game is not because of the randomized loot, the procedural magic system, or even the entirely way-too-large map full of hundreds of secrets to explore and discover. No, the reason I love this game is because of the horse collection aspect. I now run a horse barn full of about 8 horses. I have all the different types such as blackie, goldie, whitey, skelly, and scaley. When I found my first horse I was "oh cool a hores" then I drove the horse back home. Now a single day isn't complete without going in search of a horse to rescue from the tiny fists of an mini orc boss. Now I spend most of my in-game time tending to my horses, making sure they have enough feed, bringing them inside when it gets cold outside. 

What can I say, It's my life now. I love my horses.
10/10

Дело было осенью 2013-го года.
Насладившись впечатлениями от TES III Morrowind и TES IV Oblivion, я решил поискать похожие игры.
Тогда же и обнаружил игру Two Worlds. А теперь к отзыву:
Мне сложно назвать эту игру хорошей или плохой. Вообще, если бы здесь была нейтральная кнопка, как в "Кинопоиске", я бы такой же отзыв и оставил.
Плюсы:
- Атмосфера. В ней хорошо читаются нотки Обливиона, с его красивыми, светлыми и приятными пейзажами, но в то же время, в ней есть много своего, необычного, чего в других играх я пока не встречал.
- Разнообразие и разносторонность. Выбирать есть из чего, при этом, этого не настолько много, чтобы я мог потеряться.
- Саундтрек. Приятный.
Минусы:
- Сюжет. Возможно, я его плохо изучил, но для меня он показался скучным и непонятным.
- Баланс. Мне сложно назвать сбалансированной игру, в которой всего за пару часов можно стать неубиваемым мужиком, сносящим всё на своём пути. Конечно, Morrowind подобным тоже страдает, но там есть, куда идти дальше.
- Анимация. Возможно, это моя придирка, но как-то я чувствую себя неловко, когда все персонажи, кроме главного героя, умеют говорить, не открывая рта. 
Несмотря на минусы, игра вышла вполне достойной, так что я рекомендую её тем, кто устал от классики, вроде The Elder Scrolls или Готики.

The first hour of playing this game leaves you with a poor sensation of what it is. When you have gone beyond that point, it's actually really enjoyable.

The old-fashioned graphics, the dozens of exploits and odd characters gives the game a nice atmosphere.
The crafting and magic aspect is great once you get into it.
You can freely choose how the story will unfold and often you get the choice to continue helping certain NPC's or kill/betray them to help others instead.
The item and loot system is decent, but the ability to stack armor and weapons to improve the gear and save space is really brilliant. 


The fights can be somewhat clunky at times with certain skills/weapon combinations, although it can easily be avoided.
The horse-mechanics are annoying, but they have other uses besides transportation.
Quest can sometimes be rather vague in describtion, but compared to how easy they usually are these days, it can be a nice change of pace for some.

*Watch out for the random spider spawns in Cathalon, they are terrifying.

Die Frage ist wie haben das andere Leute zum laufen gebracht ? Wenn jemand ne Idee hat dann würde ich mich freuen wenn man mir die mitteilt :D Danke schon mal im vorraus und Euch alle viel Spass beim zocken <-- was auch immer das für ein Game sein wird xD

Ob ich Two Worlds einen Daumen hoch oder runter geben soll, ist mir nicht leicht gefallen. 
Kann man Two Worlds empfehlen? Die Antwort lautet ja und nein. 

Two Worlds entführt, oder besser versucht, den Spieler in eine offene Fantasywelt. Sobald man nach dem lieblosen Intro auf diese Welt losgelassen wird und zum ersten Mal die riesige Karte sieht, denkt man sich: Wow was man da alles machen kann. So ging ich also ins erste Dorf, holte mir genretypisch erste Aufträge ab und bereiste die Welt. Am Anfang wurde ich von so einigen Gegnern ins Jenseits befördert, der Frust hielt sich allerdings in Grenzen, auf Grund der Spielmechanik der Wiederbelebungspunkte. 
Die Hauptstory ließ ich erstmal außer Acht, was sich als sehr gut Entscheidung heraus stellte. So hangelte ich mich von einer Quest zur nächsten. Was mir Anfangs noch Spaß machte, wurde bald zur Pflichtübung in der Hoffnung, die Quests würden irgendwann besser. Dem war leider nicht so. Keine Spannung oder Ähnliches. Das ganze ging dann sogar soweit, dass ich unbewusst eine ganze Questreihe löste ohne dafür je einen Auftrag bekommen zu haben. Das merkte ich allerdings erst als ich mich der Hauptstory zwecks Alternative wieder zu wandte. 
Doch auch diese war nicht der Rede wert, dabei bin ich dünne Hauptstorys gewohnt. Am Ende muss ich sagen, bin ich enttäuscht von Two Worlds, denn es geht auch anders und es ist meiner Meinung nach auch nicht so schwer. 

Nehmen wir die Welt. Sie ist so riesig, aber nur die Hälfte davon ist wirklich irgendwie genutzt. Die andere Hälfte ist nur da um Gegenstände für die Hauptquest zu besorgen. Halt es gibt eine Stadt, in der man auch was erledigen kann, aber nur bis zum nehmen des Hauptquestgegenstandes. Danach hat man auch nur noch die Feinde zum niederkloppen. 
Leider schaffen es alle Quests nicht, die Welt einen erkunden zu lassen und auch so besteht kein Bedarf daran. Zu schnell hat man genug Geld, Ausrüstungsgegenstände und Erfahrungspunkte. Mir ist tatsächlichen Schleierhaft, wie man das so uninspiriert machen konnte, denn bis zum Erscheinen gab es einige Spiele, die es besser gemacht haben.

Von technischer Seite kann man sagen, dass die Grafik ganz in Ordnung geht, die Soundkullisse nett ist und die Sprachausgabe hätte besser sein können. Die Sprecher wirken nicht besonders motiviert und sind auch nicht zahlreich. 

Tja kann ich das Spiel empfehlen? Sagen wir es so. Wer The Elder Scrolls gespielt hat, sollte einen Bogen um Two Worlds machen, denn er wird nur enttäuscht werden, so belanglos ist das Spiel für ihn. Alle anderen, die sich für Openworldspiele interessieren, können bei einer Rabattaktion bedenkenlos zuschlagen, weshalb Two Worlds von mir auch einen Daumen nach oben bekommt.

So bad its good. Lots of fun ways to break the game to make it easy. story line is good but the voice acting is so poor I feel like they recorded the lines before they made the game. makes it entertaining when high tho. I have busted out laughing a couple times. good time waster with a good amount of glitches, some that will anger you some that will make you laugh. world does feel large, loot is a money grind with few items worth using. worth a quick play through before two worlds II

Эта игра как страшненькая картавая барышня. Вроде ни рожи ни гожи, а стоит, хорошо так стоит и хочется даже на трезвую!
+ Полностью открытый мир.
+ Полный "джентельменский набор" для полупесочной РПГ.
+ Хорошо написанный сюжет. Простой, но в нем нет ощущения бредовости, что редкость для "современных" игр.
+ Для многих противников важно каким оружием и/или типом урона их бьют.
+ Игра стимулирует шататься по миру.
+ Много маленьких, и не очень, фишечек которые стимулируют изучать механики.
+- В игре нет никакого респауна со временем, карту реально зачистить в ноль.
- Может показаться скучной из-за того что мир хоть и большой, но такого засилия объектов в нем как в ТЕС, например, нет.
- Общая кривоватость игры по мелочи, в прокачке есть бесполезные навыки, есть полезные но слишком ситуативные и т.д., анимации рваные хотя и нормально читаются в бою, липкое целеуказание не по "прицелу", непонятки со скриптами в квестах без указателей. Не критично, но многих будет напрягать.
- Проблемы с балансом. Рано или поздно наступает момент когда 99% противников представляют 0 угрозы.
- Квестов на такой мир маловато, при том что некоторые места из-за квестов посещаешь второй раз уже после того как зачистил их из-за скриптов, в некоторых местах вроде как напрашивается квест но нет, иногда можно получить квестовую вещь задолго до самого квеста и т.д.
Надеюсь этот обзор прочитан до покупки и не будет ревьюбомбинга как у меня в свое время.

Obilvion is to Two Worlds, as Olive Garden is to McDonald's. Addicting Third-person Western RPG junkfood.

Pros
- cheesy dialogue/sense of humour
- skill point based leveling system that is easy to reset and customize
- often sells for dirt cheap during Steam sales
      
Cons
- horse controls are garbage
- quests and geometry are a bit buggy
- combat is completely broken by liberal use of the backdash
This game is trash. I bought the game for $0.99 and I still regret wasting my money on it. Don't buy it.

Old RPG that is more fun than it first appears. If fantasy RPG is your genre than this game is worth a shot when on sale.

FYI: The old DRM is an absolute pain in the ass, this game requires you to activate your cd key before you can play which can be tough with there being two options: Phone or internet. The phone number is disconnected and the server is spotty at best. If this is a game you'd like to check out, buy it from GoG over any other vendor, they sell a DRM-free client that doesn't subject you to the problems the steam version does.

If you loved Skyrim and The Witcher games, then you'll like this.   It's ok.  

Here's a fun drinking game.  
Drink every time someone says "Verily".  
Drink every time you finish a quest, but it breaks so the marker never goes away or can't be completed.  
Drink every 10th time you kill some type of Wolf
Drink every time the Hero spots an enemy animal creature and refers to it as "bandits!" 
Every time you complete a faction quest and have no idea which faction it was stand up and spin 5 times.  
Take 2 drinks each time the main story is advanced.
This game is great im so glad that two worlds support gave me an activation code that works much love

Господа, я не буду разглагольствовать, кратко напишу: КАЧАЙТЕ ПИРАТКУ!
Причины:
Через какое-то время Вы лишитесь возможности регистрировать игру. Что первую часть TW, что вторую. Вы не сможете играть в сетевую, проходить сюжетку. Вы нихрена не сможете. Да, игра не так дорога, чтобы "вонять" по этому поводу, можно же купить и ещё и ещё за копейки, НО... А представьте, если так будет делать каждый разработчик? Это компенсация от пиратства, по средствам других покупателей? На**й такие игры.
Мало того, что во вторую часть игры запихали РЕКЛАМНЫЙ БАННЕР с какой-то, ваще левой игрой, так теперь нельзя зарегить игру. Видите-ли, попыток было предпринято много. Причём, почему-то с разных компов, хотя, у меня комп только один. В итоге, любой снос винды грозит вам проблемами с этой игрой, как показывают выводы. Так что, если хотите проходить эту и следующую часть, сюжетку в них, просто качните репак и не мучайтесь. Игры обе отличные, но это свинство от разработчиков или кто там так прокосячился, просто вымораживает.
Всем добра!))

First, there's the DRM and registration nonsense to slog through, then once you've registered, the game presents with wretched graphics, clunky interface, two-dimensional combat mechanics, and some of the worst voice acting ever perpetrated upon a helpless player. "But it's an old game, you shouldn't expect glorious graphics and great acting," some might say-  This game was made in the same year as Dragon Age: Origin and Fallout 3. It has no excuse. It's not worth the time it took to DL, let alone the purchase price, even on sale. Your 10 bucks has thousands of better ways to be spent.

- Сравнивая с аналогами тех лет - Ведьмак 1  и Обливион (который вышел намного раньше), игра кажется редкостным дерьмом без сюжета и идеи.
- Линейна, бессмыслена, глупа. 
- Крафта толком нету, только перетягивание одинаковых предметов друг на друга.
- Боевка дрисня
- Древо умений крайне бедно
- Нету интересных персонажей
- Нечем зацепить
- Зато присутствует даунизм с отпрыгиванием от нюков и атак, сделали бы перекаты тогда как в Дарк Соулс.

Своей убогостью игра чем-то напоминает Арканию также известную как Готика 4.

Единственное что реально неплохо - заглавная музыкальная тема, остальное для мазохистов.

Начну с положительных сторон этой игры:
-неплохая графика, учитывая год выхода игры, даже сейчас смотрится достойно и рвотных позывов не вызывает.
-свобода действий.
-открытый мир.
-замечательно сделанные система перков и скилов.
-боевая часть (а точнее большой спектр возможностей как умертвить недругов).
Из минусов стоит назвать только один: Слабый сюжет, сперва ничего не понятно, что за мужик за которого нам выпала судьба играть? Кто эта девушка которую надо искать? Откуда мы бежали? Что это за черные перцы в латах которые явно замыслили недоброе? В общем при всей свободе действий и большом количестве побочных квестов, весьма интересных, даже более чем основной сюжет (привет Скайрим!), основной линейки квестов могло бы в общем и не быть, и мало кто бы заметил.
Игра замечательная, 10 наемников из 10.

Can give you hours of entertainment, however, the amount of hours don't add up to finishing the game.  It get's dry and you feel like you are just grinding.  There isn't much evolution in combat, so it feels about the same later in the game as it does in the begining.  I find no advantage between classes.  If you can't swing a weapon (warrior), you aren't going to last long.  Magic doesn't do more damage, and I find it usually does significantly less.  Yes, there are places you can steal if you are a thief, but making money isn't hard, so you are giving up your ability to fight by building the steath skills.  Storyline isn't very complex.  Quests from one dude feel about the same as a quest from anyone else.  Quests don't add much to the game's feel either.  You just have an alternate reason to run around and kill everything you see.  I rate this as a good buy when it is on sale for 80 percent off or more, but don't expect a bethesda game here.

It reminds me a LOT of Gothic 3 in all the good and bad things about it. It has a huge open world, no monster respawning, even the leveling system and the effects of some spells just remind me of Gothic 3. But it just made the same mistakes as the creators of the third Gothic, it just somehow lacks in storytelling and I just cannot get immersed into its world, maybe it is just something that happens with such a huge world. Personally that was also the case for me with Oblivion and Skyrim.

<beginning_of_a_personal_nostalgic_note>
I really miss the days of playing Gothic 1 and 2, because they had relatively small worlds and a band of NPC friends (funny I still remember even some of their names after over 8 years - like Diego, Fester, Milten, Gorn).
And it is not just because of the voice acting, let's be honest the voice acting in gothic 1 and 2 wasn't perfect.
</end_of_personal_nostalgic_note>

Yeah and as for the weapons it reminds me a bit of Borderlands. There is a ton of weapon and armor models with more or less randomly generated stats + enchantments, so the final effect is, that there is practicaly an infinite number of their variations. That turns most of the progress into that weapon-stat game, where you will never have the best possible weapon or armor, there is always something stronger that can be generated by the all-powerful RNG.

Verdict:
I think the "mixed" summary that it has as of the day I wrote this review fits it well. So if you liked Gothic 3 get it, you will not be dissapointed it is almost the same in terms of gameplay. So overall I recommend it on a (-50% or -75%) sale.
Works very good on lower end devices.

This is a great game. I played it 14 years ago as a teenager, and it formed my dreams for the years to come.
I played it again now, thinking that I had emphasized the visions from this game only in my head, just to realize that they were really as amazing as I always thought! 

A must have for all RPG fans. On par with Oblivion, with a better detailed world and combat.

If you are an RPG fan and didn't absolutely love this game, I'll personally refund your money with interest!

The game is not bad for its time, the only problem i have with it , is the dialogue in the game when characters seem to talk (including your own)  the tone does not match or response does not really match up to what was said. Aside from that it's decent.

I was severely disappointed. I bought the game for $1.29. It's barely worth that, in my opinion. The voice acting is terrible, the combat is boring, the story was uninteresting, the starting lore is contrived and unoriginal, and riding horses is glitchy and annoying. But its worst offense: it felt like a chore. The only upside to this game is that the environment looked pretty nice, for its time.

3/10

One of my best memory in rpg gaming has to be Morrowind and how I "broke" the game to become an almighty flying God who could destroy an entire city with a single spell.

Two worlds won't let you do that but it's the kind of game that is so imbalanced that you can become an invincible killing-machine.

I like that they won't limit you, RPGs which try to balance their world with abstract rules have it wrong, Two Worlds and Morrowind made it great!

Yes the story is boring, the characters are stale and the voice acting ridiculous but you can break it and that is worth gold!
Poor game. No fun multiplayer. Buggy. Not even worth 1 dollar.
